Container.Name: passthroughvpn
Container.Overview: This container solves the problem of containers with no 'VPN' variant. After setting up this container, route your non-VPN Dockers through this one to protect your IP. Or host, for example a game or webserver by using your VPN Provider's IP, if your VPN Provider supports forwarding. Both WireGuard and OpenVPN are supported. Check out https://github.com/DyonR/docker-passthroughvpn for more information and setup instructions. ANY CONTAINER THAT GETS ROUTED THROUGH THIS CONTAINER WILL (BRIEFLY) USE YOUR REAL IP. THIS IS BECAUSE THE PASSTHROUGHVPN CONTAINER NEEDS TO ESTABLISH A CONNECTION WITH THE VPN FIRST. TILL THE VPN CONNECTION IS ESTABLISHED, IT WILL USE YOUR REAL IP.

Config.Name: VPN_USERNAME
Config.Description: Username used to authenticate to the VPN (OpenVPN only)

Config.Name: VPN_PASSWORD
Config.Description: Password used to authenticate to the VPN (OpenVPN only)

Config.Name: LAN_NETWORK
Config.Description: Your local network address in CIDR notation

Config.Name: ADDITIONAL_PORTS
Config.Description: A comma delimited list of ports that need to be accessible.

Config.Name: RESTART_CONTAINER
Config.Description: If set to 'yes', the container will restart itself when connection is lost

Config.Name: HEALTH_CHECK_HOST
Config.Description: Host used to check if connection is up

Config.Name: HEALTH_CHECK_INTERVAL
Config.Description: Interval in seconds between connection check
